channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Miami mayor calls for Trump to 'immediately' reinstate TPS for Venezuelans
item.description: Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."
item.content:encoded:
Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Nicolás Maduro will appear in U.S. federal court on Monday
item.description: The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.
item.content:encoded:
The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: New details emerging on how the White House intends to run Venezuela
item.description: A day after the operation in Venezuela, the White House is clarifying what running the country means, as Congress splits sharply along party lines.
item.content:encoded: A day after the operation in Venezuela, the White House is clarifying what running the country means, as Congress splits sharply along party lines.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Here's a partial list of U.S. elected officials opposing Trump's invasion of Venezuela
item.description: Trump's decision to depose Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has drawn praise inside the U.S., especially from Republican leaders. But the invasion also faces significant opposition from elected officials across the political spectrum.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's decision to depose Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has drawn praise inside the U.S., especially from Republican leaders. But the invasion also faces significant opposition from elected officials across the political spectrum.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump says the U.S. will run Venezuela. Here's how that might go
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to Ambassador Fredrick Barton, now a lecturer at Princeton University, about the challenges of U.S. nation-building in countries such as Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks to Ambassador Fredrick Barton, now a lecturer at Princeton University, about the challenges of U.S. nation-building in countries such as Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Child care providers face intense scrutiny amid funding cuts and allegations of fraud
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Maria Snider, vice president of the Minnesota Child Care Association - an advocacy group - about the impact of the freeze on federal child care funds.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Maria Snider, vice president of the Minnesota Child Care Association - an advocacy group - about the impact of the freeze on federal child care funds.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: A tale of two U.S. interventions and why Venezuela is not Panama 2.0
item.description: Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.
item.content:encoded:
Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Venezuela opposition in limbo as the world wonders who is in charge
item.description: President Trump said the United States would "run" Venezuela. But interim President Delcy Rodríguez denounced the U.S. operation and rejected the idea of U.S. control.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the United States would "run" Venezuela. But interim President Delcy Rodríguez denounced the U.S. operation and rejected the idea of U.S. control.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Who is María Corina Machado, Venezuela's Nobel Peace Prize winning opposition leader?
item.description: The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.
item.content:encoded:
The United States has captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Opposition leader María Corina Machado has been one of his biggest critics.

(Image credit: Stian Lysberg Solum)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Top House Democrat on what Congress should do next after Venezuela operation
item.description: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: U.S. Representative Adam Smith weighs in on the Trump administration's actions in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley
